channel.title: WhereverTheWindTakesMe on A J Greengrove's Site
channel.description: Recent content in WhereverTheWindTakesMe on A J Greengrove's Site

item.title: Goodbye Faraway Peaceful Town
item.description: Goodbye Faraway Peaceful Town: instead of a shepherd in Arcadia, I associate romanesca with town themes (damn gamer).

item.title: Revelations in Ancient Tombs
item.description: Revelations in Ancient Tombs: what happens when you apply “chroma”, Gesualdo-style, on a romanesca?

item.title: Prelude to a Foreboding
item.description: Prelude to a Foreboding: The static use of the arpeggio motive creates tension; “trailer music” vibes.

item.title: Autumn Moon Dance
item.description: Autumn Moon Dance: This dance-like motive unfolds in a “minor-variant romanesca”.

item.title: Doppelganger Takes Over
item.description: Doppelganger Takes Over: The motif is one of my favorite fantasy tropes, albeit rare: it sounds quite dark.

item.title: Twilight in the Marshlands
item.description: Twilight in the Marshlands: This motif, I feel is rather soundtrack-like, serious and heavy.

item.title: Waltz with Me Moose Giants
item.description: Waltz with Me Moose Giants: a chameleon motive, very useful for weaving counterpoint.

item.title: Fireflies Circling in the Rain
item.description: Fireflies Circling in the Rain: The flourishing motif changes along with the underlying modes or scales.

item.title: Chilly Nights, Quiet Winds
item.description: Chilly Nights, Quiet Winds: a meandering motive searchs out and seeks, perhaps for a warmer breeze.

item.title: False Relations in an English Town
item.description: False Relations in an English Town: “Dalza’s basse danse meets the english cadence”.

item.title: Wherever The Wind Takes Me
item.description: Wherever The Wind Takes Me: arpeggiation of a single motive, resulting in a deceptively simple prelude.

item.title: Wherever the Wind Takes Me - Album Release!
item.description: “This ‘dungeon nylon guitar’ album ranges from early music pastiches to soundtrack-like music, or fantasias if you will. A great way to start this ‘dungeon crawl’ of game soundtracks.”
